newsitem.title: FINLAND: ALANDSBANKEN SEES SMALLER 96 CREDIT LOSSES.
newsitem.headline: ALANDSBANKEN SEES SMALLER 96 CREDIT LOSSES.

text.p: Alandsbanken Ab said in a statement on Friday it expected its full-year credit losses to fall compared with 1995 while net income from financial operations was expected to remain largely unchanged.
The bank's new branches would burden the result somewhat, Alandsbanken said.

"Net income from financial operations is not expected to changed markedly compared to last year," Alandsbanken said in its first half interim report. In 1995, net income from financial operations was 113.9 million markka.
In the first six months, net income from financial operations rose two percent to 58.0 million markka.
"Credit losses are expected to fall slightly," it said. In full-year 1995, credit losses totalled 19.6 million markka.
In January-June, Alandsbanken's credit losses fell to 4.8 million markka from 6.6 million.
"The new branches on the mainland will burden the bank's result somewhat during 1996," it added.
In January-June, Alandsbanken said total costs excluding credit losses increased 14.6 percent, "mainly as a result of new branches set up on the mainland."
Operating profit fell 16 percent to 28.6 million markka in the first half. In full-year 1995, it was 45.9 million markka.
